DataElement.preferredName: Sequencing Library Nucleic Acid Capture Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of days from the date of specimen collection to the date of nucleic acid capture.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection of double stranded DNA fragments flanked by oligonucleotide sequence adapters to enable their analysis by high-throughput sequencing.:The use of various techniques to selectively isolate nucleic acids of interest, typically using hybridization to a oligonucleotide molecule.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Determining the number or amount of something.
